alert.note: Alert for Poweshiek; Tama (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 07 at 4:46PM CDT until May 07 at 5:30PM CDT by NWS DesMoines
info.description: The National Weather Service in Des Moines has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Poweshiek County in central Iowa... Southern Tama County in central Iowa... * Until 530 PM CDT. * At 445 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Oakland Acres, or 6 miles west of Grinnell, moving east at 40 mph. THIS IS A DESTRUCTIVE STORM FOR POWESHIEK COUNTY. HAZARD...Baseball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be severely injured. Expect shattered windows, extensive damage to roofs, siding, and vehicles. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Grinnell and Grinnell Regional Airport around 455 PM CDT. Searsboro around 500 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include Montezuma, Malcom, Brooklyn, Deep River, Guernsey, Victor and Victor. This includes Interstate 80 between mile markers 181 and 204. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...DESTRUCTIVE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
